intro: Tylophora cinerascens, commonly known as the ash-colored tylophora, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a follicle that splits open to release seeds. Tylophora cinerascens is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported therapeutic properties.
